meanings.definition: The arrangement of similar plant or animal fossils in the same stratigraphic level.
meanings.sent1: The homotaxes of the fossils in the rock layer helped the scientists understand the ancient environment.
meanings.sent2: In paleontology, homotaxes play a crucial role in determining the age of different geological layers.
meanings.sent3: The homotaxes of the fossils were like a puzzle waiting to be solved by the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The homotaxes of the fossils whispered stories of the past to those who could decipher them.
meanings.sent5: The homotaxes of the fossils stood out like a map guiding scientists through time.

meanings.sent1: Her passion for homotaxes led her to pursue a career in paleontology.
meanings.sent2: The university offered a course specifically focusing on the study of homotaxes.
meanings.sent3: Studying homotaxes felt like exploring a hidden treasure trove of ancient life.
meanings.sent4: The research on homotaxes opened new doors to understanding the history of life on Earth.
meanings.sent5: The book on homotaxes was a fascinating journey into the world of fossils and stratigraphy.
